title: Usability Principles Classification (Expanded)
description: Drag each interface scenario into the correct usability principle category.

activities.title: User Interface Examples
activities.prompt: Classify each example according to the usability principle it demonstrates:

items.text: A booking website grays out the 'Confirm' button until all required fields are filled in.
After clicking 'Save', a green message appears saying 'Document saved successfully'.
All buttons across the application use the same blue color and rounded corners.
The homepage displays only essential options: Login, Sign Up, and Learn More.
When entering a password, a strength meter shows if it's weak, medium, or strong in real-time.
After accidentally deleting a photo, a 'Restore' button appears for 30 seconds.
A form provides a dropdown list of countries instead of making the user type one.
The website uses high-contrast text and provides 'alt text' for all images for screen readers.
A government website correctly uses macrons for words like 'kōrero' and 'whānau' in all its menus and headings.
